episodes.title: Epstein Victims Say Files Release Feels Like "Deliberate Attempt To Intimidate Survivors" | N18G
episodes.description:
USA LIVE: Democratic Women’s Caucus holds news conference with Epstein survivors | CNBC TV18
More than 20 victims of Jeffrey Epstein urged Attorney General Pam Bondi to respond to multiple questions about the exposure of victims’ information and inconsistent redactions in the Justice Department’s release of millions of files related to the late convicted sex offender.
The letter, which came as Bondi was set to testify before Congress on Wednesday, includes a list of 14 questions about the department’s review of the documents, adding that for victims of Epstein, the release “remains incomplete in a way that is both staggering and indefensible.”
News conference with members of the Democratic Women’s Caucus, House Judiciary Committee Democrats, House Oversight Committee Democrats, and Epstein survivors ahead of Attorney General Pam Bondi’s appearance at a House Judiciary Committee hearing
WASHINGTON, DC - Senator Chuck Schumer ,along with survivors of Jeffrey Epstein, unveil “Virginia’s Law” legislations that aims to eliminate statute of limitations for sex traffickers and abusers.
Lawmakers tried Monday to interview Ghislaine Maxwell, but the former girlfriend and confidante of Jeffrey Epstein invoked her Fifth Amendment rights to avoid answering questions that would be incriminating.
Ghislaine Maxwell has invoked her Fifth Amendment rights against self-incrimination in her ongoing deposition with the House Oversight Committee, according to a person familiar with the matter.
Maxwell, Jeffrey Epstein’s accomplice, is appearing before the panel virtually. She is currently serving time at a minimum security prison in Bryan, Texas.
Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick is facing bipartisan calls to resign after he appeared in a recent batch of files linked to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Sen. Adam Schiff (D-Calif.) accused Lutnick in a statement Monday of having “lied” about the extent of his connection to Epstein. Lutnick has sought to downplay their relationship, saying in a podcast appearance last year he vowed in 2005 to never again be in the same room as Epstein.
Reps. Ro Khanna and Thomas Massie are challenging the Justice Department for redacting the names of six men in the publicly released materials related to the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein — and they could take matters into their own hands to reveal their identities.
Maxwell was questioned during a video call to the federal prison camp in Texas where she’s serving a 20-year sentence for sex trafficking. She’s come under new scrutiny as lawmakers try to investigate how Epstein, a well-connected financier, was able to sexually abuse underage girls for years.
The deposition came on the same day that the Department of Justice has begun allowing members of Congress to review unredacted files related to Epstein files, according to a letter that was sent to lawmakers. The ltter, obtained by The Associated Press, says they can come to the Justice Department with 24 hours notice and review the more than 3 million files without redactions. They can’t bring anyone with them, and can take notes but not make electronic copies.
#ghislainemaxwell #epsteinfiles #uscongress #jeffreyepstein #cnbctv18 #usatoday #livenews

episodes.title: Rep. Stansbury Questions Rep. James Comer Over Clintons Offering Sworn Testimony on Epstein | N18G
episodes.description:
House Committee Reviews Resolutions Holding Clintons in Contempt of Congress | Epstein Files | CNBC TV18
House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer opposes an amendment to shift from criminal to civil contempt for Bill Clinton, citing concerns over extended litigation. Comer stated, 'The Clintons have lawyered up' and argued they are attempting to delay the investigation into the Epstein matter until the House leadership changes. Ranking Member Robert Garcia and Representative Melanie Stansbury challenged the Chairman, noting that the Clintons have offered transcribed, sworn testimony and that negotiations are ongoing.
WASHINGTON, D.C. - House panel to advance contempt of Congress measures against Bill and Hillary Clinton.
House Republicans are set to take the next steps on Wednesday to hold former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton in contempt of Congress for failing to comply with committee subpoenas related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
On Wednesday, Oversight Chairman James Comer is set to hold a markup of two resolutions finding the Clintons in contempt of Congress after they defied a subpoena for a deposition with the committee last week. 
"The Clintons are not above the law, and the House Oversight Committee will move to hold them in contempt of Congress," Comer, a Republican, said in a statement last week. "If Democrats refuse to hold the Clintons accountable, they will expose themselves as hypocrites."
#hillaryclinton #billclinton #epsteinfiles #cnbctv18 #uspolitics #trump

episodes.title: James Comer: Ghislaine Maxwell Ordered To Tell all at House Oversight Epstein Deposition | N18G
episodes.description:
House Committee Reviews Resolutions Holding Clintons in Contempt of Congress | Episten Files | CNBC TV18
Rep. James Comer (R-Ky.) revealed Wednesday that Jeffrey Epstein’s imprisoned accomplice, Ghislaine Maxwell, will sit for a deposition before the House Oversight Committee on Feb. 9.
Maxwell — who has already been interviewed by Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche — is serving a 20-year prison sentence for conspiring with Epstein to sex-traffic dozens of girls, some as young as 14. Comer announced Maxwell’s appearance during a markup of contempt resolutions against former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton.
WASHINGTON, D.C. - House panel to advance contempt of Congress measures against Bill and Hillary Clinton.
House Republicans are set to take the next steps on Wednesday to hold former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton in contempt of Congress for failing to comply with committee subpoenas related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
On Wednesday, Oversight Chairman James Comer is set to hold a markup of two resolutions finding the Clintons in contempt of Congress after they defied a subpoena for a deposition with the committee last week. 
"The Clintons are not above the law, and the House Oversight Committee will move to hold them in contempt of Congress," Comer, a Republican, said in a statement last week. "If Democrats refuse to hold the Clintons accountable, they will expose themselves as hypocrites."

episodes.title: Rep. Ansari Questions Pam Bondi Commitment To Transparency on Epstein Files | Bill Clinton | N18G
episodes.description:
House Committee Reviews Resolutions Holding Clintons in Contempt of Congress | Epstein Files | CNBC TV18
US Representative Yassamin Ansari accused the Trump administration and Department of Justice of an 'intentional cover-up' regarding the Jeffrey Epstein files. Speaking during a House Oversight Committee hearing, Ansari noted the DOJ has 'blown past' deadlines and released heavily redacted documents. House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer defended the process, stating Attorney General Pam Bondi is complying with document requests despite technical disputes over redactions, while the committee prepares for a contempt vote against the Clintons.
WASHINGTON, D.C. - House panel to advance contempt of Congress measures against Bill and Hillary Clinton.
House Republicans are set to take the next steps on Wednesday to hold former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton in contempt of Congress for failing to comply with committee subpoenas related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
On Wednesday, Oversight Chairman James Comer is set to hold a markup of two resolutions finding the Clintons in contempt of Congress after they defied a subpoena for a deposition with the committee last week. 
"The Clintons are not above the law, and the House Oversight Committee will move to hold them in contempt of Congress," Comer, a Republican, said in a statement last week. "If Democrats refuse to hold the Clintons accountable, they will expose themselves as hypocrites."
#hillaryclinton #billclinton #epsteinfiles #cnbctv18 #uspolitics #trump

episodes.title: Rep. Anna Paulina Luna Suggests Fines And Contempt For Clintons In Epstein Files Inquiry | N18G
episodes.description:
House Committee Reviews Resolutions Holding Clintons in Contempt of Congress | Episten Files | CNBC TV18
During a House Oversight Committee session, Representative Anna Paulina Lina proposed fining the Clintons $1,000 a day to compel testimony regarding the Epstein files. The speaker argued that 'most Americans would go to jail for defying a subpoena' and suggested financial penalties as a tool to motivate compliance. Ranking Member Garcia and other members discussed ongoing negotiations for transcribed depositions, while the committee also addressed the release of DOJ files and potential impeachment.
WASHINGTON, D.C. - House panel to advance contempt of Congress measures against Bill and Hillary Clinton.
House Republicans are set to take the next steps on Wednesday to hold former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton in contempt of Congress for failing to comply with committee subpoenas related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
On Wednesday, Oversight Chairman James Comer is set to hold a markup of two resolutions finding the Clintons in contempt of Congress after they defied a subpoena for a deposition with the committee last week. 
"The Clintons are not above the law, and the House Oversight Committee will move to hold them in contempt of Congress," Comer, a Republican, said in a statement last week. "If Democrats refuse to hold the Clintons accountable, they will expose themselves as hypocrites."

episodes.title: US President Trump Extends Christmas Wishes To 'Sleazebags Who Loved Jeffrey Epstein' | N18G
episodes.description:
'Merry Christmas to all, including the many Sleazebags who loved Jeffrey Epstein'

US President Donald Trump issued a combative Christmas message on Truth Social, launching a sweeping attack on political rivals, media organisations and individuals he claims were associated with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

episodes.title: Epstein Files: Trump flew on Epstein jet 8 times in the 90s | Donald Trump | 4K Video | N18G
episodes.description:
'Trump Flew On Epstein's Private Jet 8 Times'

President Donald Trump flew on convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's private jet 'many more times than previously has been reported,' according to an email from a New York prosecutor that forms part of a new batch of documents about Epstein released Tuesday by the U.S. Justice Department.
